documentType: search warrant application and supporting documents
summary: This is an FBI application filed in the District of New Hampshire on July 1, 2020, for a warrant to use a cell-site simulator to locate Ghislaine Maxwell's cellular device. The application includes an affidavit detailing probable cause based on her indictment, arrest warrant, and phone records linking her to associates. The filing packet also contains the sealed indictment against Maxwell and the related arrest warrant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary target of the investigation and search warrant. She is charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury related to Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier. The indictment alleges Maxwell assisted, facilitated, and contributed to his sexual abuse of multiple minor girls from 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney who represented Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. Her phone number was in contact with the target cellular device subscribed to 'G Max'.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's sister. Her phone number was in contact with the target cellular device in or about May 2020.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell shares a joint bank account. His phone number was in contact with the target cellular device in or about March 2020.

persons.name: Andrea K. Johnstone
persons.context: United States Magistrate Judge for the District of New Hampshire who signed the search warrant application on July 1, 2020.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: United States Magistrate Judge who signed a prior warrant for cellphone location information (GPS Warrant) for the target device on June 30, 2020.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: United States Magistrate Judge who signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: United States District Judge before whom attorney Laura Menninger appeared for oral argument on Maxwell's behalf in or about June 2020.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, whose name appears on the indictment.

connections.description: Alleged conspirators in a scheme to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls. The indictment states they had a personal and professional relationship and were intimate partners from approximately 1994 to 1997.
Menninger represented Maxwell in civil litigation. The target cellular device ('G Max') was in contact with Menninger's phone within the last 30 days prior to the affidavit.
Sisters. The target cellular device was in contact with Isabel Maxwell's phone in or about May 2020.
They share a joint bank account, and Maxwell's Amazon account sent multiple packages to Borgerson within approximately the last year. Their phones were in contact in or about March 2020.
Maxwell allegedly groomed and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, who was approximately 14 years old when they met, between 1994 and 1997.
Maxwell allegedly interacted with and groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico in 1996, including providing an unsolicited massage while the victim was topless.
Maxwell allegedly groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London between 1994 and 1995, introducing her to Epstein and encouraging massages that led to sexual abuse.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant Issued for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned a sealed indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. U.S. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed an arrest warrant the same day.

events.title: GPS Warrant Signed for Target Cellphone
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Katharine H. Parker signed a warrant for prospective and historical cellphone location information for the device subscribed to 'G Max', finding probable cause it would reveal Maxwell's location.

events.title: Search Warrant Application for Cell-Site Simulator
events.description: An FBI Special Agent applied to the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire for a warrant to use a cell-site simulator to precisely locate the 'G Max' cellular device, believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, including Victims 1, 2, and 3, at properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition (Alleged Perjury)
events.description: During a deposition in civil litigation, Maxwell allegedly gave false testimony, stating she did not know about a scheme to recruit underage girls and was not aware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition (Alleged Perjury)
events.description: During a continued deposition, Maxwell allegedly gave false testimony regarding her awareness of sex toys, Epstein's sexual activities with others, and whether she had ever given anyone a massage.

events.title: Maxwell's Last Recorded Entry into U.S.
events.description: Customs and Border Patrol records indicated Ghislaine Maxwell, a U.S. citizen, most recently entered the United States in or about June 2019, with no record of departure since.

locations: New York Residence (Upper East Side, Manhattan, NY)
keyFacts: The FBI sought to use a cell-site simulator to locate Ghislaine Maxwell's phone, subscribed under the name 'G Max', to execute an arrest warrant issued on June 29, 2020.

Phone records showed the target device was in contact with Maxwell's attorney Laura Menninger, her sister Isabel Maxwell, and associate Scott Borgerson (with whom she shared a joint bank account) in the months leading up to the application.

The sealed indictment charges Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, and transportation related to the sexual abuse of three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) by Jeffrey Epstein from 1994-1997.

The indictment alleges Maxwell groomed victims by befriending them, discussing their lives, normalizing sexual topics, undressing in front of them, and participating in or being present for sexual abuse.

Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions, specifically denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, interaction with other underage girls, and ever giving massages.
